Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits that enlarge and turn brown with yellow halos.

treatment.schedule: Spray every 10–12 days starting at first symptom.

Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.precautions: Avoid overhead irrigation, use certified seeds, rotate with non-solanaceous crops.

Pepper__bell___healthy.symptoms: Uniform green leaves, no lesions or yellowing.

treatment.organic: Maintain proper soil nutrients and compost.

Pepper__bell___healthy.precautions: Ensure proper drainage, balanced NPK, and sunlight exposure.

Potato___healthy.symptoms: Uniform green leaves and clean tubers with no spots or rot.

treatment.organic: Use compost and maintain soil pH between 5.5–6.5.
treatment.schedule: Inspect weekly for pest or disease.

Potato___healthy.precautions: Use certified seed tubers and avoid waterlogging.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves and tubers with white fungal growth under humidity.

treatment.organic: Trichoderma viride 5 g/L + Neem oil 3 ml/L
treatment.schedule: Spray at first symptom, then every 7–10 days.

Potato___Late_blight.precautions: Avoid late evening irrigation, destroy infected leaves, rotate crops.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Brown concentric rings on leaves, yellowing and premature drying.
Potato___Early_blight.precautions: Remove infected debris and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surface and olive-green mold beneath leaves.

treatment.organic: Neem oil 5 ml/L or Baking soda 5 g/L spray.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.symptoms: Upward curling leaves, yellowing, and stunted plant growth.

treatment.chemical: Imidacloprid 0.3 ml/L or Thiamethoxam 0.25 g/L (whitefly control)
treatment.schedule: Spray insecticide every 10 days at early growth.

Tomato__Tomato_YellowLeaf__Curl_Virus.precautions: Use yellow sticky traps; remove infected plants; control whiteflies.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small brown spots on leaves and fruits with yellow halo.

treatment.schedule: Spray every 10 days from early stage.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.precautions: Avoid overhead watering; destroy infected debris.

Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Circular spots with dark borders and light centers on older leaves.
Tomato_Septoria_leaf_spot.precautions: Ensure good air flow; avoid watering foliage.

Tomato_healthy.symptoms: Dark green foliage, no yellowing or pest marks.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.symptoms: Yellow speckling on leaves, webbing underneath, premature leaf drop.

treatment.schedule: Spray both sides of leaves at early infestation.

Tomato_Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider_m.precautions: Avoid dry dusty conditions; maintain humidity.

Tomato_Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric spots on lower leaves and fruit shoulder rot.
Tomato_Early_blight.precautions: Stake plants; remove infected leaves; avoid excess nitrogen.

Tomato__Target_Spot.symptoms: Brown circular spots with grey centers on leaves and fruits.

treatment.organic: Neem oil 5 ml/L or Baking soda 5 g/L spray.
treatment.schedule: Spray at first appearance; repeat after 10 days.

Tomato__Target_Spot.precautions: Avoid continuous tomato cropping; provide spacing.

Tomato_Late_blight.symptoms: Irregular water-soaked patches with white mold; fruit rot during humidity.

treatment.organic: Trichoderma spray 5 g/L + Neem seed kernel extract 5%
treatment.schedule: Apply at symptom appearance and every 7 days.

Tomato_Late_blight.precautions: Avoid planting near potatoes; ensure good air circulation.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled yellow and green leaves, curled leaf edges, reduced fruit set.

treatment.chemical: No direct control; manage aphid vectors.
treatment.organic: Neem seed extract 5% spray + virus-free seedlings.

Tomato__Tomato_mosaic_virus.precautions: Avoid tobacco handling; disinfect tools; remove infected plants.
